item.title: Develop and monitor a Spark application using existing data in Amazon S3 with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
item.description: Organizations face significant challenges managing their big data analytics workloads. Learn how to use SageMaker Unified Studio ðŸš€ to develop and monitor Spark applications.
item.content:encoded:
Organizations face significant challenges managing their big data analytics workloads. Data teams struggle with fragmented development environments, complex resource management, inconsistent monitoring, and cumbersome manual scheduling processes.

Solution overview

This solution uses SageMaker Unified Studio to execute and oversee a Spark application, highlighting its integrated capabilities:

  1. Create an EMR Serverless compute environment for interactive applications using SageMaker Unified Studio.
  2. Create and configure a Spark application.
  3. Use TPC-DS data to build and run the Spark application using a Jupyter notebook in SageMaker Unified Studio.
  4. Monitor application performance and schedule recurring runs with Amazon MWAA integrated.

Prerequisites

  • An AWS account â€“ If you don't have an account, you can create one.
  • A SageMaker Unified Studio domain â€“ For instructions, refer to Create an Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio domain.

Run the following code to develop your Spark application:

spark.read.parquet("s3://blogpost-sparkoneks-us-east-1/blog/BLOG_TPCDS-TEST-3T-partitioned/store/").createOrReplaceTempView("store")

# Load additional datasets
spark.read.parquet("s3://bucket/item/").createOrReplaceTempView("item")
spark.read.parquet("s3://bucket/store_sales/").createOrReplaceTempView("store_sales")

Note: Make sure you have the emr-serverless:GetDashboardForJobRun IAM permissions to generate the dashboard link.

Monitor jobs in the Spark UI

On the Jobs tab of the Spark UI, you can see:

  • The action that triggered the job
  • The time it took (for this example, 41 seconds, but timing will vary)
  • The number of stages and tasks
